result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Lee Grunow

records.addlTxt: Scheduling conference on December 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions: 
No violent or abusive contact with the party/parties named in the bail bond. 
Report to Sheboygan County Detention Center, 2923 S 31st Street for MPR (mug, print & release) by 10-7-22 before 3:00 PM
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia.  
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional. 
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.

03:26 PM Defendant Michael Lee Grunow in court.  Prosecuting attorney Corey R. Hoze in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Received complaint waived reading, Court reviews penalty/charge portions of the complaint, NG plea entered. 950/Marsy's Law complied with.
Scheduling conference scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.
